events.description: Elections for the lower house of parliament occurring this weekend.
Release of Japan's fourth-quarter Gross Domestic Product data.
Weekly auction of 10-year Japanese government bonds.

facts.fact_text: Japan’s 10-year government bond yield eased to around 2.23% on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: Japan’s 10-year government bond yield eased to around 2.23% on Thursday

facts.fact_text: The 10-year bond auction average yield was 2.249%, up from 2.095% at the previous sale.

evidences.evidence_text: average yield of 2.249%, up sharply from 2.095% at the previous sale

claims.claim_text: The ruling LDP is expected to gain seats in the upcoming election.

evidences.evidence_text: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s ruling LDP is expected to gain seats

claims.claim_text: Takaichi's expansionary fiscal policies are raising concerns over debt-funded spending and the fiscal outlook.

evidences.evidence_text: her push for expansionary fiscal policies raising concerns over debt-funded spending and the country’s fiscal outlook

claims.claim_text: Japan's Q4 GDP is expected to rebound after a sharp contraction.

evidences.evidence_text: expected to rebound after the prior quarter’s sharp contraction

claims.claim_text: The 10-year bond auction showed softer demand due to election jitters.

evidences.evidence_text: this week’s 10-year bond auction showed softer demand amid election jitters

evidence.evidence_text: remaining range-bound for two weeks now as investors positioned ahead of lower house elections this weekend
Japanese bonds and the yen have faced pressure since Takaichi took office
this week’s 10-year bond auction showed softer demand amid election jitters
